title: Test Engineer-RF/Acoustic
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, extraordinary ideas can become phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. With the growth of Apple, we have built new opportunities for individuals to work on the most exciting new products introduced by Apple. We are seeking for individual that meet the following criteria to join us. This position will require frequent traveling to manufacture site and works closely with the various engineering to support the needs for operational team.
description: -  Identify and develop test and calibration solutions that span across the end-to-end supply chains to achieve extraordinary operational efficiencies -  Collaborate with both internal and external partners in enabling test solutions including hardware, software, processes and infrastructure -  Define test and calibration strategy, roadmap and supporting infrastructure and systems that are efficient, robust and flexible to be deploy to wide range of products -  Work hand-in-hand with counterparts at the manufacturing sites to ensure successful roll out of new test and calibration solutions -  Continuous improvements of solutions and processes through monitoring, analysis of manufacturing information to find opportunities of optimization -  Failure analysis supports with design teams, including plan/develop and implement DOE [ Design of Experiment ] to root cause issue and make recommendation for test coverage or tester design changes. -  Improve product quality by tracking/closing test gaps and correlation issues across supply chain during development stage. -  Assessment of contract manufacturers' resource & technical capabilities and to collaborate with CMs' management teams for improvement and supports
key_qualifications: -  Intuitive understanding in at least one of the following technologies: Wireless, Acoustic, Optical, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical.etc -  Strong curiosity to keep up with the latest technologies and applications, willing to contribute to breakthrough -  Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work cross functionally in a global environment. -  Familiar in usage of Machine Learning and statistical tools to drive deep analysis, to enable supply chain End-End optimization -  Ability to break down sophisticated problems and evaluate tradeoffs between proposed solutions -  Proven track record to work independently and to deliver high quality solutions to tight schedules.
education_experience: BS/MS or equivalent experience in Computer/Electronics/Electrical Engineering
additional_requirements: -  3+ Years of proven experience or equivalent -  Ability to read and write clean, clear, efficient and understandable code in one or more relevant programming languages (C, C++, Python) -  Experience in machine learning, big data and artificial intelligence is a plus
